translation: uzda [a set of leather straps that are put around a horse's head to allow its rider to control it]
sentence: Saddles, bits and bridles are frequently ornamented with substantial amounts of silver.

translation: płyta chodnikowa [a large, flat piece of stone or concrete used for paths, floors, etc]
sentence: Today, with cheap and frequent shipping routes, timber has replaced flagstone as the most viable resource on the island.
Some mushrooms look innocuous but are in fact poisonous.

translation: rozradowany [feeling or expressing great happiness, especially because of a success]
sentence: The fans were in a jubilant mood after the victory.

translation: niedbały, luźny [not strict, severe, or careful enough about work, rules, or standards of behavior]
sentence: The subcommittee contends that the authorities were lax in investigating most of the cases.

translation: wysoki, wyniosły, szczytny [formal; (of buildings, mountains, etc.) very high and impressive; (of a thought, an aim, etc.) deserving praise because of its high moral quality]
sentence: Man's life here is incomplete, and the more lofty his aims, the more worthy his labors, the more incomplete will it appear to be.

translation: trącać nosem [to touch, rub, or press something or someone gently and/or in a way that shows your love, especially with the head or nose, usually with small repeated movements]
sentence: My dog came and nuzzled my foot to try and cheer me up.

translation: ratownik medyczny [a person who is trained to do medical work, especially in an emergency, but who is not a doctor or nurse]
sentence: Paramedics treated the injured at the roadside.

translation: płaczliwy, żałosny [used to describe something that sounds slightly sad]
sentence: I love the plaintive sound of the bagpipes.

translation: skórka [the hard outer layer or covering of particular fruits and foods]
sentence: Add the grated rind of one lemon.

translation: smarki [informal; the thick liquid that is produced in your nose]
sentence: I resolved to start carrying more handkerchiefs, because after the Reverend, I was fresh out of snot rags.

translation: szlochać [to cry noisily, taking in deep breaths]
sentence: You're not going to help matters by lying there sobbing!

translation: oblać [literary; (especially of a color, light, or feeling) to spread all over or through someone or something]
sentence: The room was suffused with a soft golden light.

translation: snuć się, spacerować [to walk around slowly in a relaxed way or without any clear purpose or direction]
sentence: We spent the morning wandering around the old part of the city.

translation: wiązka, kosmyk włosów [a delicate, thin, and sometimes twisting piece or line of something]
sentence: A wisp of smoke from the campfire curled in the air.
